intro: Cyrtandra menziesii, commonly known as the Menzies' cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant grows as an erect shrub, often reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are opposite in arrangement. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in coastal and montane forests. Cyrtandra menziesii plays a significant role in the ecological dynamics of its native habitat, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of Hawaiian ecosystems.
